episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including a historical job of spotting pilchards in Cornwall, the coincidental name of a sound designer for a film, a tree in Pakistan that has been under arrest for over a century, and the origins of Pad Thai as part of a fascist government initiative in Thailand.

facts.fact: There was a job in the 19th century, which just involved looking at the sea and being able to tell when there were pilchards under the surface.
The sound designer for the movie King Richard is called Richard King.
There is a tree in Pakistan that has been under arrest for more than 120 years.
Pad Thai was invented as part of a fascist government initiative.
